item.title: Graph theoretic proofs for some results on banded inverses of $M$-matrices
item.description: arXiv:2412.18611v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This work concerns results on conditions guaranteeing that certain banded $M$-matrices have banded inverses. As a first goal, a graph theoretic characterization for an off-diagonal entry of the inverse of an $M$-matrix to be positive, is presented. This result, in turn, is used in providing alternative graph theoretic proofs of the following: (1) a characterization for a tridiagonal $M$-matrix to have a tridiagonal inverse. (2) a necessary condition for an $M$-matrix to have a pentadiagonal inverse. The results are illustrated by several numerical examples.
item.dc:creator: S. Pratihar, K. C. Sivakumar

item.title: Investigating Multidimensional Degenerate Hybrid Special Polynomials and Their Connection to Appell Sequences: Properties and Applications
item.description: arXiv:2412.18612v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper explores the operational principles and monomiality principle that significantly shape the development of various special polynomial families. We argue that applying the monomiality principle yields novel results while remaining consistent with established findings. The primary focus of this study is the introduction of degenerate multidimensional Hermite-based Appell polynomials (DMHAP), denoted as ${}_{\mathbb{H}}\mathbb{A}^{[r]}_n(l_1, l_2, l_3, \dots, l_r; \vartheta)$. These DMHAP form essential families of orthogonal polynomials, demonstrating strong connections with classical Hermite and Appell polynomials. Additionally, we derive symmetric identities and examine the fundamental properties of these polynomials. Finally, we establish an operational framework to investigate and develop these polynomials further.
item.dc:creator: Awatif Muflih Alqahtani, Saleem Yousuf, Shahid Ahmad Wani, Roberto S. Costas-Santos

item.title: Mathematics for energy systems: Methods, modeling strategies, and simulation
item.description: arXiv:2412.18615v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We offer an insight into our mathematical endeavors, which aim to advance the foundational understanding of energy systems in a broad context, encompassing facets such as charge transport, energy storage, markets, and collective behavior. Our working techniques include a combination of well-posed mathematical models (both deterministic and stochastic), mathematical analysis arguments (mostly concerned with model dimension reduction and averaging, periodic homogenization), and simulation tools (numerical approximation techniques, computational statistics, high-performance computing).
item.dc:creator: Nicklas J\"averg{\aa}rd, Grigor Nika, Adrian Muntean

item.title: A systematic approach to Diophantine equations: open problems
item.description: arXiv:2404.08518v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This paper collects polynomial Diophantine equations that are amazingly simple to write down but are apparently difficult to solve.
item.dc:creator: Bogdan Grechuk

item.title: A simple proof of Werner Schulte's conjecture
item.description: arXiv:2404.08646v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Lately, Werner Schulte has conjectured that for all positive $n>1$, $n$ divides $\frac{(n-2)! (n-1)!}{2^{n-3}} + 4$ if and only if $n$ is prime. In this paper, We use elementary methods, to give a simple proof of this conjecture.
item.dc:creator: Djamel Himane

item.title: Derivation of some definite integrals
item.description: arXiv:2412.10395v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this work derivations of definite integrals listed in Prudnikov volume I, Gradshteyn and Ryzhik and a few other tables are produced. Special cases of these integrals in terms of fundamental constants are also evaluated. The method used in these derivations is contour integration.
item.dc:creator: Robert Reynolds
